adrFormatAddress: 55 3rd Ave, New York, NY 10003, USA

originalText.text:
My Favorite Hot Pot spot for Manhattan. With clean environment, Perfect service, and good a selection of meet.

Me and my friend had an amazing hot pot date. Although it was busy we got seated in 5 mins. I wasn’t really satisfied with the Tavel first cause it was just near to the self serve area.  But wasn’t a big deal, we ordered a lot so we didn’t had much space, that was the only thing made us upset. The price is affordable as we eat a good meal of hot pot for $140 for two. I like how was the service it used to be when I get to seat in the main lounge. Other than we was satisfied.

But wasn’t a big deal, we ordered a lot so we didn’t had much space, that was the only thing made us upset. The price is affordable as we eat a good meal of hot pot for $140 for two. originalText.text:
I loved the hot pot eating experience here. The burners are small and everyone has their own hot pot station with broth. The dipping soy sauce can be pre made or made yourself and everyone orders meats to share.

I’ve certainly had better flavors though. I should have ordered the spicy and creamy pork combination to try both but I was recommended strongly to try just the creamy pork as the spicy is not good.

But I missed the spice throughout this entire meal.

The broth was slightly weak, just wish it had more umami and it absorbed the broth flavor better.

I think this was a very expensive meal, but it was satisfying.

originalText.text: Shopping around Soho on a still warm sunny afternoon, we are met with a bit chilly weather late afternoon. What’s better than hot pot when it’s chilly? At Dolar Shop, you can choose up to two of your favorite flavors for your personal hot pot. The restaurant is clean and tidy with a very very organized sauce bar. After being seated by their friendly and attentive staffs, we ordered our food and approached their sauce bar with their in-house dried shrimp paste. It’s so good that it was put on literally everything from meat to veggies to grapes to durian pancakes. While waiting for the hot pot to boil, we enjoyed the freshly made durian pancakes. All the beef and veggies are super fresh which compliments their delicious soup base. Staffs come refill the soup as soon as it boils down without mentioning. After finishing a delicious meal, we were offered ice cream to cool us off from the yummy spicy hot pot.

originalText.text: You get your own bowl for hot pot here so it’s quite hygienic. There’s a decent selection of ingredients but you can also get set meals at a more affordable price. Lots of free cold dishes and dessert. Attentive staff and comfy booths.

text.text: You get your own bowl for hot pot here so it’s quite hygienic. There’s a decent selection of ingredients but you can also get set meals at a more affordable price. Lots of free cold dishes and dessert. Attentive staff and comfy booths.

originalText.text:
I wanted to rate 2 or 3 stars but I really want the employer to pay attention to their problems.
1⃣️There are so many little flies here. In the restroom, and during the dinner. The little flies always stay on our food. It’s so annoying and not clean.
2⃣️When I choose to pay by credit card, they charged cc processing fee to customers, which shouldn’t be in charged by the customers. ( Picture is the proof) According to GENERAL BUSINESS LAW
§518: NY LAW RELATED TO CREDIT AND DEBIT CARD SURCHARGES. Businesses are not allowed to advertise a price and add a surcharge at the point of sale when a consumer elects to pay with a credit card. I reported to the manager, and the manager gave me these reasons:
• The surrounding restaurants do the same
• They offered different payments to customers, which is by cash( However, customers has the right to choose their own payment approach, I don’t take this excuse)
• They have processed in this way for long time.
I didn’t satisfied with these explanation. So I decided to leave this 1 star rate.
I won’t suggest people to come. Not for the food nor the service here.
